name: N-(3-chlorophenyl)-3,3,3-trifluoro-2-(trifluoromethyl)propanamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-4014
Reason: 3-Chlorophenyl and trifluoromethyl functionalities significantly impact the melting point. The chlorine atom introduces a strong withdrawing group, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +50°C. The fluorine atoms, being heavy and rigid, enhance the crystalline structure and molecular weight, contributing approximately +20°C each. The phenyl group introduces additional pi-pi interactions and rigidity, estimated at around +30°C. The trifluoromethyl group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +10°C. The chlorine and fluorine atoms also increase the melting point due to the presence of polar functional groups, estimated at around +10°C each.
